### Gitian builds | File | commit 564e1ab0f3dc573bd3ea60a80f6649c361243df9
(master) | commit 6058386d7c51d48a3334168b412413dbbff4567e
(master and this pull) | |--|--|--| | *-aarch64-linux-gnu-debug.tar.gz | [`1c2a2879aff10050...`](https://drahtbot.space/gitian/bitcoin/bitcoin/564e1ab0f3dc573bd3ea60a80f6649c361243df9/bitcoin-564e1ab0f3dc-aarch64-l
> Closing as this is a wrong approach due to https://www.gnu.org/software/make/manual/html_node/MAKE-Variable.html#MAKE-Variable\n\nCould you explain why you think that your approach is wrong?
> Could you explain why you think that your approach is wrong?\n\nIt prevents passing `-j` to sub-`make`s.

This seems to be the only `+` left after your suggested changes (which look good to me, fixing `cd`ing into directories that have not been created). Wouldn't it be possible/better to drop this last `+`, too? Or is there a reasoning why this line has to be prefixed with a `+`, creating a folder?\n\nTo be honest: I've not run `make` to test it out and I'm new to the code base, so just asking.

> Not-creating that folder causes an error when one runs `make --dry-run`. The `+` forces `make` to execute a line even in `--dry-run` mode.\n\n@hebasto And that error would still occur - even though you did remove the `+` in front of the following `cd` line which caused the error in the first place?
